abstract: Paper presented at the 17th European Conference on Information Systems in Vienna, 8-10 June 2009. Full texst is available at http://www.ecis2009.it/papers/ecis2009-0253.pdf
rawRecordXml:
<record><header><identifier>
oai:www.e-space.mmu.ac.uk:2173/92887</identifier><datestamp>2010-02-25T13:42:26Z</datestamp><setSpec>hdl_2173_701</setSpec></header><metadata><oai_dc:dc xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" xmlns:oai_dc="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/ http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc.xsd" ><dc:title>"Who is in charge and whose rules are followed?": power in an intra-organisational IS project</dc:title><dc:creator>Hekkala, Riitta</dc:creator><dc:creator>Urquhart, Cathy</dc:creator><dc:creator>Ivari, Netta</dc:creator><dc:subject>Interorganisational Systems</dc:subject><dc:subject>Interpretivist Research</dc:subject><dc:subject>Power</dc:subject><dc:subject>Grounded Theory</dc:subject><dc:description>This interpretive grounded theory study describes and analyses major power issues in a Scandinavian inter-organisational IS project which spanned four organisations, two suppliers, one national organisation and a research organisation. The paper explores different dimensions of power that emerged during the project – sources of power, power as resistance, reasons for the power struggle, and power as exercised, We conclude that, while power issues in ISD projects are by no means a new phenomenon, these power issues were exacerbated in this IOIS project due to the project governance structures necessary to coordinate several organisations.</dc:description><dc:description>Paper presented at the 17th European Conference on Information Systems in Vienna, 8-10 June 2009. Full texst is available at http://www.ecis2009.it/papers/ecis2009-0253.pdf</dc:description><dc:date>2010-02-24T12:05:53Z</dc:date><dc:type>Presentation</dc:type><dc:type>Meetings and Proceedings</dc:type><dc:identifier>Hekkala, R., Urquhart, C., and Iivari, N. "Who is in charge and whose rules are followed?": power in an intra-organisational IS project.</dc:identifier><dc:identifier>http://hdl.handle.net/2173/92887</dc:identifier><dc:language>en</dc:language><dc:relation>http://www.ecis2009.it/</dc:relation><dc:relation>http://www.ecis2009.it/papers/ecis2009-0253.pdf</dc:relation></oai_dc:dc></metadata></record>
